1.title: Bandit T/A
1.plot: See if the Burt Reynolds' Bandit Edition black TransAm has been able to stand the test of time as one of the most awesome muscle cars in history. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

2.title: Rat Roaster Engine
2.plot: A 1932 Ford Roaster is due for a new power plant - a 600-horsepower monster with duel carbs and a 5-speed manual. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

3.title: Jekyll and Hyde Exhaust
3.plot: Stacey reworks the exhaust system for the "Rat Roadster", hiding its custom frame modifications from the casual onlooker. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

4.title: The V8 Barstool
4.plot: Part go-cart, part garden tractor and part insanity, Stacey creates a V8 powered barstool and dives right into some muffler tech. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

5.title: Tri-Powers & Six-Packs
5.plot: Stacey builds a tri-power out of old parts, then pulls out the big Mopar parts to assemble a power-pounding six-pack. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

6.title: Banshee: Paint & Body
6.plot: The "Banshee" has been painted, and brings the question, does it still resemble a '95 Miata? Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

7.title: Building Floors
7.plot: Stacey pulls out the tools and shows how to create solid metal floors from nothing. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

8.title: Ol' Smoke Corvette
8.plot: Stacey builds a 180+ MPH supercar for a fraction of the cost, using a brand-new 'Vette and some aftermarket parts. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

9.title: Ol' Smoke Corvette: Part 2
9.plot: Stacey takes the new supercar out on the road. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

10.title: Carpet and Interior Painting
10.plot: Stacey rolls the "Banshee" into the shop and brings a tired interior back to life; painting the dash and door panels. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

11.title: The Air Filter Story
11.plot: Stacey looks at one of the first aftermarket parts available to the public, the performance air filter. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

12.title: Jeep Suspension Lift
12.plot: Stacey helps a family take their 2007 Jeep JK to the next level, while maintaining its ability to use on the street or off-road. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

13.title: Off-road Rig
13.plot: Stacey puts the finishing touches on the '07 Jeep Wrangler with off-road bumpers, body armor, and some off -road lights, and builds a very capable off-road rig that is still civil enough to be driven every day. Only on SPEED. Motors, cars, speed, speedtv.com, video, gearz, gears, speed x, speedx, Stacey David.

1.title: Rust Repair
1.plot: Stacey repairs the rusting quarter panels on rocker Ted Nugent's Bronco.

2.title: ATV Revival
2.plot: Stacey stuffs a junkyard engine in a derelict 70's ATV, adds some ingenuity, and comes away with a pretty cool rig.

3.title: The Banshee Project
3.plot: Stacey blows apart an innocent Miata, converting it into a V8 powered screaming machine, nicknamed "Banshee."

4.title: Engine Installation
4.plot: Stacey stuffs a 400 HP V8 into a Mazda Miata.

5.title: LARC 60
5.plot: Stacey takes one of the world's largest 4-wheeled vehicles for a spin.

6.title: Restoration Tips and Tricks
6.plot: Stacey David restores vintage manifolds and steering wheels.

7.title: The Deuce is 75
7.plot: Stacey David celebrates the 75th anniversary of Ford's classic roadster.

8.title: The Banshee Is Back
8.plot: Stacey David starts the Banshee down the final stretch, installing a new suspension and brake system.

9.title: Body Nip & Tuck
9.plot: Body parts fly as a Mazda Miata gets a major facelift as Stacey transforms into the Banshee.

10.title: Cherry Bomb
10.plot: Stacey examines a well known performance exhaust system.

11.title: Building a Better Workhorse
11.plot: Stacey takes a late model diesel pickup and toughens it up in the span of a single weekend.

12.title: The Rat Roaster
12.plot: Stacey builds a 1960's style hot rod.

13.title: The Budget Hot Rod
13.plot: Stacey builds a steel-bodied 1932 Roadster for about twenty grand.

14.title: The Tire Story
14.plot: Stacey visits Coker Tires, a store that specializes in supplying rubber for classic cars.

15.title: The Bushmaster Body
15.plot: Stacey transforms rocker/outdoorsman Ted Nugent's Bronco into a beast of a vehicle, the "Bushmaster."

1.title: Knuckle Buster
1.plot: Stacey brings a weel worn 1973 Chevy pickup back to life; "Iron Man" Ivan Stewart chats with Stacey.

2.title: Engine Swap & Locker Installation
2.plot: In the "KnuckleBuster" project, Stacey deals with a sick engine and transmission.

3.title: Interior & Seat Re-do
3.plot: Stacey shows how to dig into a car's wornout interior and bring it back to life without spending a fortune.

4.title: Silver State Classic
4.plot: Stacey shows viewers the last real outlaw race in the country, run over 90 miles of wide open, two-lane Nevada highway; back in the shop Stacey addresses one of the most versatile tools.

5.title: Ladder Bar System
5.plot: Stacey fashions a nostalgic car with leaf springs hook up like a modern drag car without losing its vintage look.

6.title: Hunting in a Salvage Yard
6.plot: Stacey walks through the ins and outs of hunting for elusive parts in a salvage yard.

7.title: The Rat Roaster Is Back!
7.plot: Stacey adds some cool details to lock a wild little '32 roadster into the Hot Rod and Rock and Roll culture of 1969.

8.title: The New Challenger vs. the World
8.plot: Stacey compares a new Challenger to a vintage 1970 440 six-pack.

10.title: Accessories and Motor Mounts
10.plot: Stacey takes the steps required in laying out an engine swap, including hand fabricating motor mounts, thus allowing one to place any engine in any vehicle, regardless of make.

11.title: Vintage Hot Rod Straight 6
11.plot: Stacey David takes a vintage straight six engine that has been sleeping in a crate for almost 40 years and puts on the right pieces to make it a force to be reckoned with again.

12.title: Returns
12.plot: Stacey puts the final touches on this '73 Chevy pickup.

13.title: The Hot Wheels Story
13.plot: Stacey discovers the fascinating story of how those little metal cars came to be, and how they changed American car culture.

1.title: Gamma Goat
1.plot: Designed for military use, this articulating, six-wheel-drive, amphibious monster is street legal; Stacey discusses welding safety.

2.title: Reviving an Old Piece of Junk
2.plot: Stacey pulls a derelict semi truck out of a junkyard and slowly coaxes the old truck back to life.

3.title: The Speed Racer Story
3.plot: Stacey digs into the history of the cartoon, and its cultural impact on generations of fans; Stacey manages to "borrow" the real Mach 5 and put it thru the paces against Racer X and other challengers.

4.title: The Clunker Story
4.plot: Stacey discusses the recent "Cash for Clunkers" program; aftermarket steps address fuel mileage with simple upgrades.

5.title: OEM vs. Aftermarket
5.plot: Stacey answers questions from viewers, comparing original equipment manufacturer parts to their aftermarket replacements.

6.title: '67 Mercury Cougar: Part 1
6.plot: Stacey preps a classic '67 Mercury Cougar for some wild modifications; a look at the world of die cast models.

7.title: '59 Ford Stepside Pickup
7.plot: Stacey rolls in a '59 Ford Stepside truck that is being built by the Herobox organization to help raise awareness for their goal of sending Heroboxes to all of our men and women serving in the military.

8.title: The Blue Angels
8.plot: Stacey recounts the history of the US Navy's precision flying team, the Blue Angels, then steps into the cockpit for a fly-along.

9.title: Heavy Metal
9.plot: Representing the Navy's Blue Angels precision flying team, Stacey's next project involves that old International Cabover truck.

10.title: Rat Roaster
10.plot: After a visit to the Hot Rod Institute in South Dakota, the Rat Roaster '32 Ford roadster rolls back into the GEARZ shop wearing a new coat of green paint and sporting a custom interior.

11.title: '67 Mercury Cougar: Part 2
11.plot: After Stacey gets rid of the stock shock towers and changes the front suspension on a solid '67 Cougar, he turns this little old lady's car into a corner-carving, road-gripping beast.

12.title: Boss 429
12.plot: Stacey takes a look at one of the most incredible engines that Ford ever built, the Boss 429.

13.title: Classic Cougar
13.plot: Stacey visits a salvage yard that specializes in Cougar parts, then upgrades the rearend and rear suspension of the V8 Inteceptor.

14.title: Trail Boss
14.plot: Stacey starts with a stock Jeep JK, then builds a rig that is just as comfortable on the road as it is on the trail; the influence of Mickey Thompson on the world of off-road racing.

15.title: Rat Exhaust
15.plot: Stacey installs a custom exhaust system underneath the Rat Roaster; back to the Trail Boss Jeep, Stacey works on improving its street performance.

1.title: Rat Roaster Details
1.plot: Stacey rolls the Rat Roaster back into the shop to dig into the final assembly of this wild roadster.

2.title: Final Assembly
2.plot: Stacey walks through the finishing touches needed for a project can truly be called "done".

3.title: When Bad Things Happen to Good Projects
3.plot: Stacey uses Ted Nugent's old broken down and discarded Bronco as an example of how to re-kindle the passion in a project others have given up on.

4.title: Hot Rod of the Air
4.plot: Stacey restores a a vintage biplane, the Stearman PT-17; clearing hazing headlight lenses.

5.title: Discovering Bigfoot
5.plot: Stacey visits the home of Bob Chandler, the mad genius behind the Bigfoot monster truck.

6.title: V8 Interceptor
6.plot: Stacey walks through the massive Boss 9, 520ci engine in the '67 Cougar.

7.title: Towing Tech
7.plot: Setting up a simple trailer hitch.

8.title: Ram 1500 Express
8.plot: In 1968, Plymouth stood the muscle car world on its ear with the incredible RoadRunner; in 2011 Mopar has done it again with the Ram 1500 Express.

10.title: The Banshee Payoff
10.plot: The Banshee comes full circle as Stacey recounts the buildup of this incredible V8 powered Mazda Miata, then airs it out.

11.title: The Drag 'n' Wagon
11.plot: Stacey sets out to create a modern street machine from a lowly base pickup that anybody can afford.

12.title: Old Trucks and Other Junk
12.plot: Stacey converts a '67 Ford pickup from a floor stick to a column shift.

13.title: Interior Swap
13.plot: Stacey strips the old upholstery from the Darg 'n' Wagon, and installs new leather.

1.title: Preventing Theft
1.plot: Stacey rolls back Ted Nugents big 80's Bronco fresh out of the paint shop. In keeping with the natural theme, the Zebra is back with modern, earth tone stripes on its flanks in an environmentally friendly water-based paint.

2.title: The New Face of Slot Cars
2.plot: Today on GEARZ, Stacey brings back the Drag'N'Wagon to see if he can get the beast to breathe some fire! The first thing he puts on is an ATI supercharger system to get some air sucking in.

3.title: Super Cars, Kit Cars & the SL-C
3.plot: Stacey discusses a kit car that can run with the Ferraris and Lamborghinis.

4.title: Building the SL-C
4.plot: Stacey builds a supercar from a kit, one that will rival the best European exotics.

5.title: Do-It-Yourself Engine
5.plot: Stacey builds an LS7 engine utilizing a new GM plan.

6.title: Boosting the Ford Ecoboost
6.plot: Stacey boosts both performance and fuel economy on a 6-cylinder Ford F150; rejuvenating a classic Mustang's black paint job.

7.title: Engine Rebuild
7.plot: Stacey and an engine rebuilder show it is possible to breathe new life into an old engine without spending a fortune; final assemby for Ted Nugent's old zebra B.

8.title: Volunteer Fire Truck
8.plot: Stacey transforms a stock Chevy dually pickup into a state-of-the-art Brush truck for a local volunteer fire department.

9.title: Station Wagon to Hot Rod
9.plot: Stacey shows how much fun a wagon can be when it has an LS engine under the hood, and two four-barrel carburetors sitting on it.

10.title: Lifting a Caddy
10.plot: Stacey adds 3 1/2" to country artist Jason Sturgeon's Escalade; Predator, one of the most successful Monster Trucks of all time.

11.title: Truck Tools, Leather & Twin Turbos
11.plot: Stacey adds some key tools and equipment to a new truck; installing leather interiors from a kit; packing twin turbos on an LS7 small block engine.

12.title: Movie Cars & Pop Culture
12.plot: Stacey rolls Heavy Metal back into the shop and begins to lay out some of the incredible modifications that he is going to be doing on this old junk yard '69 International Cabover truck.

13.title: Puttin' a Stick in a Mustang
13.plot: Stacey rolls in a 1990 Mustang cop car and shows how easy it is to pull out an automatic tranny, and stuff in a Tremec 6spd so you can shift the gears properly.

imdb.title: Stacey David's GearZ
plot: Underground gear head sensation Stacey David takes his lifelong passion for tinkering to the extreme. Originally airing on ESPN2 then transitioning to SPEED. After SPEED was rebranded the show moved to MavTV and Velocity.
